column1: # webanno.custom.Participants | Participant # webanno.custom.Events | Events # webanno.custom.Corefchains | Coref | AttachTo=webanno.custom.Participants
#id=1
#text=Last winter , my husband and I took the train to Chicago .
#id=2
#text=Before the train trip , we had to check the train schedule to find out what choices we had about when we could leave .
#id=3
#text=We found the train schedule on the World Wide Web .
#id=4
#text=After we learned that there were two trains a day , we decided to take the morning train departing at 9:05 a.m. .
#id=5
#text=We purchased our tickets by paying with a credit card using the Amtrak web site .
#id=6
#text=After we paid for our tickets , they were emailed to us , and then we printed them .
#id=7
#text=On the day of our trip , we drove our car to the train station , which is about 10 miles away from our house .
#id=8
#text=We parked at the station , and because it 's a little train station instead of a big city , we did n't have to pay for parking .
#id=9
#text=We took our suitcases and went to the platform , where other people were waiting .
#text=Eventually -LRB- a little late -RRB- , the train pulled in .
#text=There were already passengers on the train from other stops .
#text=We boarded the train and found two seats near each other .
#text=Throughout the train trip , we chatted with each other , and we also talked to one of the other passengers , who was confused about the train backing up .
#text=We explained to him that sometimes they have to do that at the stations , and it was nothing to be concerned about .
#text=The train pulled into the station at Chicago about 20 minutes late , which is very typical in Chicago .
#text=We got off the train and were happy to stretch our legs .
